definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: I don't approve of your defeatist attitude.
sentences.chinese: 我不赞成你这种失败主义的态度。

sentences.english: Young people should face and defeat adversities; they should not have the mood of defeatism.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人应面对和战胜逆境，不应该有失败主义心理。

sentences.english: Yet wariness should not be mistaken for defeatism.
sentences.chinese: 而且谨慎不应该被误解为失败主义。

sentences.english: There is no point going out there with a defeatist attitude.
sentences.chinese: 怀着一种失败主义的态度上阵根本没有任何意义。

sentences.english: Not bothering to vote is a sure sign of defeatism .
sentences.chinese: 连投票都不投，纯粹是失败主义。

definition: nationalism/national self-determination/principle of nationalism, the first of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning parity between China and the great powers)/racism
to feel animosity toward foreigners or outsiders/xenophobia

pinyin: she4 hui4 Da2 er3 wen2 zhu3 yi4
